flawed_nl_solution:
When she poured water into the gallon for 6 minutes, the total time in seconds she took is 6 minutes * 60 seconds/minute = <<6*60=360>>360 seconds.
If in 20 seconds she poured 1 gallon of water into the tank, in 360 seconds, she poured 360 seconds / 20 seconds/gallon = <<360/20/1=18>>18 gallons of water into the tank.
Aubriella will have to pour 50 gallons - 18 gallons = <<50-18=23>>23 more gallons into the tank to fill the tank.
#### 23

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 23. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
